alert.note: Alert for Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 09 at 6:05AM CST until January 09 at 6:15AM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN HENRY AND NORTHEASTERN HOUSTON COUNTIES... At 605 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Webb, or 9 miles east of Dothan, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Webb and Kinsey around 610 AM CST. Columbia around 615 AM CST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Haleburg, Tumbleton, Sigma, Grandberry Crossroads, Pearce, Enon, Avon, Barber, Pleasant Plains, and Headland Municipal A/P. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
